title: Space Debris Removal Startup Dark Partners with Bordeaux Airport
summary:
French space junk removal startup Dark has signed a partnership with Bordeaux Airport in preparation for the establishment of the company’s “Site B” facility. Dark was founded in 2021 with the aim of developing an air-launched rocket capable of deploying payloads of up to 300 kilograms into low Earth orbit. The company has since narrowed […]
The post Space Debris Removal Startup Dark Partners with Bordeaux Airport appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: AST SpaceMobile’s prototype satellite makes first 5G connection
summary: AST Space Mobile said Sept. 19 its Blue Walker 3 test satellite that's been in orbit for a year recently relayed its first 5G phone call to an ordinary smartphone in a cellular dead zone.

title: LeoLabs, SAIC to develop space-tracking software platform
summary: SAIC and LeoLabs have signed an agreement to jointly develop a space-tracking software platform.

title: Hungarian Astronaut to Visit ISS Aboard Axiom 5 Mission
summary:
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade has confirmed that a Hungarian astronaut will be aboard the Axiom-5 mission to the International Space Station. The Hungarian to Orbit (HUNOR) programme was launched in 2021 with the aim of sending an astronaut to the ISS by 2024. The programme was part of the country’s first space […]
The post Hungarian Astronaut to Visit ISS Aboard Axiom 5 Mission appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: CACI optical terminals pass initial tests required for Space Development Agency satellites
summary: CACI International’s optical communication terminal passed initial ground tests required to compete for Space Development Agency satellite contracts, the company announced Sept. 18.
